Ocarina of Time Fairy Fountains

From Zelda Dungeon Wiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

In Ocarina of Time, Link can find a total of 13 Fairy Fountains. Six of which are Great Fairy Fountains. Only the first two Great Fairy Fountains are required to complete the quest, while the remainder of the fountains will allow Link to acquire some upgrades and new abilities. At any point during his quest, Link can revisit a Great Fairy Fountain to fill up both his Life and Magic Meter.

The seven regular fairy fountains are filled with fairies that Link can use to heal up, or capture them into an Empty Bottle for later use.

Great Fairy Locations

  • Location: Death Mountain Trail

    Conditions: Acquire Bombs

    Reward: The Magic Meter and Spin Attack

    Located at the very peak of the Death Mountain Trail. Link will need to have acquired the Bombs from Dodongo's Cavern in order to scale Death Mountain. Right next to Kaepora Gaebora, there is a wall that can be blasted open with a Bomb and inside is the Great Fairy. The Great Fairy will teach you the Spin Attack ability and in the process grant you the Magic Meter. This is a required Great Fairy as you will need magic to use the required magic-based weapons that are later acquired.

  • Location: Hyrule Castle

    Conditions: Acquire Bombs (Past)

    Reward: Din's Fire

    Located on the pathway leading to Hyrule Castle. Reach this area from the Market and then climb up the nearby vines. Jump beyond the gate and you'll find a sign that says Dead End, with a boulder behind it. Blast the boulder and crawl into the Great Fairy Fountain. Link will need to first visit the Great Fairy Fountain on Death Mountain before he can acquire this item. This Great Fairy Fountain is required, as the reward is Din's Fire, which is essential to enter the Shadow Temple.

  • Location: Zora's Fountain

    Conditions: Acquire Bombs

    Reward: Farore's Wind

    Located at the southeast corner of Zora's Fountain, behind Lord Jabu-Jabu. Place a bomb against the brown boulder to explode the entire wall, revealing the Great Fairy Fountain. The reward is Farore's Wind, which allows Link to create a warp point at any single portion of any dungeon. By using Farore's Wind a second time, Link can warp there. This ability even allows Link to warp across dungeons. While it is not essential, it is helpful in quickly navigating through dungeons.

  • Location: Death Mountain Crater

    Conditions: Megaton Hammer

    Reward: Magic Meter Upgrade

    After acquiring the Megaton Hammer from the Fire Temple, make your way to the west end of the Death Mountain Crater. Here you will find a series of large rocks that can be broken up by using the Megaton Hammer. Walk inside to find the Great Fairy Fountain. The reward is an upgraded Magic Meter, which will double the capacity of magic that Link can have at any given time.

  • Location: Desert Colossus

    Conditions: Lens of Truth

    Reward: Nayru's Love

    When you first arrive at the Desert Colossus, if you follow the wall on the north side, you'll find a pair of Palm Trees with a cracked wall. Blast it open and head inside to find the Great Fairy Fountain. The reward is Nayru's Love, which will temporarily create a barrier around Link, preventing him from taking any damage for a period of time.

  • Location: Outside Ganon's Castle

    Conditions: Golden Gauntlets

    Reward: Defense Upgrade

    In the area just outside of Ganon's Castle, if you walk to the far end, you'll find a massive pillar right up against the wall. After acquiring the Golden Gauntlets from within Ganon's Castle, Link will have the ability to remove this large pillar, allowing access to the Great Fairy Fountain. The reward here is an upgrade to Link's Defense, which causes Link to take half the amount of damage from all attacks, which basically doubles the amount of health Link has.

Fairy Fountains

  • Location: Sacred Forest Meadow

    Conditions: None

    Once you reach the staircase within the Sacred Forest Meadow that leads up to Saria and the Forest Temple, you can turn around to find a ladder. Climb up and there is a small area in the center of the maze that has a hole. Drop down inside to find the Fairy Fountain.

  • Location: Kakariko Village Graveyard

    Conditions: Acquire Bombs

    In the Kakariko Village Graveyard, there is a grave in the first row that has some flowers in front of it. Pull it back and drop into the hole beneath the grave. There is a treasure chest that contains a Piece of Heart, and behind it there is a wall that can be blown up with a Bomb. Blast it open and round the corner to find the Fairy Fountain.

  • Location: Hyrule Field

    Conditions: Acquire Bombs

    Found at the far northwest corner of Hyrule Field. Make your way and cross the small stream of water in this location and you'll find an enemy Peahat. Nearby there is a lone boulder that can be blown up with some bombs. Drop down into the hole to find the Fairy Fountain.

  • Location: Zora's River

    Conditions: Acquire Bombs

    Found along the south-central portion of Zora's River, on the higher ledge. As a child, you can reach this area by grabbing a Cucco at the entrance of Zora's River, and bringing it all the way to the east end of the river. You'll have to toss the Cucco up ahead, climb up platforms, and then grab the Cucco once again. Once you pass the main part of Zora's River, just before the bridge, Turn back and face to the west right where the water splits off in two directions. Use the Cucco to follow the water that floats directly to the west and try to land on the nearby ledge. Climb up the ladder here to get to the top of Zora's River, where you'll find a boulder surrounded by small rocks. Blow it up and drop down to find the Fairy Fountain.

  • Location: Gerudo's Fortress

    Conditions: Song of Storms

    While traveling through the various tunnels at the Gerudo's Fortress, there is an area on the ground level where there are two entrances and a series of wooden crates. If you walk near the wooden crates on the right side, the Shard of Agony will begin to chime. Play the Song of Storms to create a small hole and drop down to find the Fairy Fountain.

  • Location: Desert Colossus

    Conditions: Song of Storms

    Walk over to the south end of the Desert Colossus, where you will find a dried up pond. Navi will fly over to a nearby rock and turn green. Stand on this rock and play the Song of Storms, causing water to fill the Oasis, and making a bunch of fairies appear.

  • Location: Zora's Domain

    Conditions: Song of Storms

    Right when you enter Zora's Domain, jump off the ledge to the left to land in the water or on top of the ice. Stand on the small island here and play the Song of Storms, causing a small hole to appear. Drop down to find the Fairy Fountain.

Retrieved from "https://www.zeldadungeon.net/wiki/index.php?title=Ocarina_of_Time_Fairy_Fountains&oldid=169245"
